summary: Uluru, also called Ayers Rock, is a massive sandstone formation in central Australia. It holds great spiritual significance for the local Pitjantjatjara people. This ancient monolith is surrounded by a landscape of springs, caves, and rock art. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, Uluru attracts tourists worldwide. Located in the Uluṟu-Kata Tjuṯa National Park, it is a symbol of Australia's unique natural beauty and cultural heritage.
title: Uluru
